alert.note: Alert for Benton; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 1:43AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Benton and northeastern Washington Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 143 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles north of Gravette to 5 miles east of Decatur to 4 miles south of Springtown. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Fayetteville... Springdale... Rogers... Bentonville... Bella Vista... Lowell... Pea Ridge... Tontitown... Cave Springs... Highfill... Garfield... Gateway... Northwest Arkansas Regional Air... Hiwasse... Hobbs State Park... War Eagle... Miller... Centerton... Johnson... Elm Springs... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 69 and 93. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for northwestern Arkansas.
